intro: Stachydeoma angulata, commonly known as the angular stachydeoma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive angular leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from pink to purple, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Stachydeoma angulata is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
